body:
^ is not defined on boolean operands, hence ^= is not defined. It's never been defined, so it was not "disabled". The only reason this works in say C is because there are no booleans in C; instead they are mapped to integers. ^ is an integer operation.

!= is already doing exactly what the ^ operation via the detour of booleans mapped to C achieves. In fact, ^ may not do the right thing if the mapping of bool -> int is not 100% consistent. That is != is clearer and cleaner. No need for another operator.
